verses.verse: Moreover, the word <S%H1697><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H1961><s%> to me saying, <S%H559><s%>
"And you, son <S%H1121><s%> of man, <S%H120><s%> take <S%H5375><s%> up a lamentation <S%H7015><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> Tyre; <S%H6865><s%>

and say <S%H559><s%> to Tyre, <S%H6865><s%> who dwells <S%H3427><s%> at the entrance <S%H3996><s%> to the sea, <S%H3220><s%> merchant <S%H7402><s%> of the peoples <S%H5971><s%> to many <S%H7227><s%> coastlands, <S%H339><s%>' Thus <S%H3541><s%> says <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> God, <S%H3068><s%> "O Tyre, <S%H6865><s%> you have said, <S%H559><s%> 'I am perfect <S%H3632><s%> in beauty. <S%H3308><s%>'
"Your borders <S%H1366><s%> are in the heart <S%H3820><s%> of the seas; <S%H3220><s%> Your builders <S%H1129><s%> have perfected <S%H3634><s%> your beauty. <S%H3308><s%>

"They have made <S%H1129><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> [your] planks <S%H3871><s%> of fir <S%H1265><s%> trees <S%H1265><s%> from Senir; <S%H8149><s%> They have taken <S%H3947><s%> a cedar <S%H730><s%> from Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> to make <S%H6213><s%> a mast <S%H8650><s%> for you.

"Of oaks <S%H437><s%> from Bashan <S%H1316><s%> they have made <S%H6213><s%> your oars; <S%H9295><s%> With ivory <S%H8127><s%> they have inlaid <S%H6213><s%> your deck <S%H7175><s%> of boxwood <S%H839><s%> from the coastlands <S%H339><s%> of Cyprus. <S%H3794><s%>

"Your sail <S%H4666><s%> was of fine <S%H8336><s%> embroidered <S%H7553><s%> linen <S%H8336><s%> from Egypt <S%H4714><s%> So that it became <S%H1961><s%> your distinguishing <S%H5251><s%> mark; <S%H5251><s%> Your awning <S%H4374><s%> was blue <S%H8504><s%> and purple <S%H713><s%> from the coastlands <S%H339><s%> of Elishah. <S%H473><s%>

"The inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Sidon <S%H6721><s%> and Arvad <S%H719><s%> were your rowers; <S%H9588><s%> Your wise <S%H2450><s%> men, <S%H2450><s%> O Tyre, <S%H6865><s%> were aboard; they were your pilots. <S%H2259><s%>

"The elders <S%H2205><s%> of Gebal <S%H1380><s%> and her wise <S%H2450><s%> men <S%H2450><s%> were with you repairing <S%H2388><s%> your seams; <S%H919><s%> All <S%H3605><s%> the ships <S%H591><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%> and their sailors <S%H4419><s%> were with you in order to deal <S%H6148><s%> in your merchandise. <S%H4627><s%>

"Persia <S%H6539><s%> and Lud <S%H3865><s%> and Put <S%H6316><s%> were in your army, <S%H2428><s%> your men <S%H376><s%> of war. <S%H4421><s%> They hung <S%H8518><s%> shield <S%H4043><s%> and helmet <S%H3553><s%> in you; they set <S%H5414><s%> forth your splendor. <S%H1926><s%>

"The sons <S%H1121><s%> of Arvad <S%H719><s%> and your army <S%H2428><s%> were on your walls, <S%H2346><s%> [all] around, <S%H5439><s%> and the Gammadim <S%H1575><s%> were in your towers. <S%H4026><s%> They hung <S%H8518><s%> their shields <S%H7982><s%> on your walls, <S%H2346><s%> [all] around; <S%H5439><s%> they perfected <S%H3634><s%> your beauty. <S%H3308><s%>

"Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> was your customer <S%H5503><s%> because <S%H4480><s%> of the abundance <S%H7230><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> [kinds] of wealth; <S%H1952><s%> with silver, <S%H3701><s%> iron, <S%H1270><s%> tin, <S%H913><s%> and lead, <S%H5777><s%> they paid <S%H5414><s%> for your wares. <S%H5801><s%>

"Javan, <S%H3120><s%> Tubal, <S%H8422><s%> and Meshech, <S%H4902><s%> they were your traders; <S%H7402><s%> with the lives <S%H5315><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> and vessels <S%H3627><s%> of bronze <S%H5178><s%> they paid <S%H5414><s%> for your merchandise. <S%H4627><s%>
"Those from Beth-togarmah gave <S%H5414><s%> horses <S%H5483><s%> and war <S%H9463><s%> horses <S%H9463><s%> and mules <S%H6505><s%> for your wares. <S%H5801><s%>

"The sons <S%H1121><s%> of Dedan <S%H1719><s%> were your traders. <S%H7402><s%> Many <S%H7227><s%> coastlands <S%H339><s%> were your market; <S%H5506><s%> ivory <S%H8127><s%> tusks <S%H7161><s%> and ebony <S%H1894><s%> they brought <S%H7725><s%> as your payment. <S%H814><s%>

"Aram <S%H758><s%> was your customer <S%H5503><s%> because <S%H4480><s%> of the abundance <S%H7230><s%> of your goods; <S%H4639><s%> they paid <S%H5414><s%> for your wares <S%H5801><s%> with emeralds, <S%H5306><s%> purple, <S%H713><s%> embroidered <S%H7553><s%> work, <S%H7553><s%> fine <S%H948><s%> linen, <S%H948><s%> coral, <S%H7215><s%> and rubies. <S%H3539><s%>

"Judah <S%H3063><s%> and the land <S%H776><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> they were your traders; <S%H7402><s%> with the wheat <S%H2406><s%> of Minnith, <S%H4511><s%> cakes, <S%H6436><s%> honey, <S%H1706><s%> oil, <S%H8081><s%> and balm <S%H6875><s%> they paid <S%H5414><s%> for your merchandise. <S%H4627><s%>

"Damascus <S%H1834><s%> was your customer <S%H5503><s%> because of the abundance <S%H7230><s%> of your goods, <S%H4639><s%> because <S%H4480><s%> of the abundance <S%H7230><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> [kinds] of wealth, <S%H1952><s%> because of the wine <S%H3196><s%> of Helbon <S%H2463><s%> and white <S%H6713><s%> wool. <S%H6785><s%>

"Vedan <S%H2051><s%> and Javan <S%H3120><s%> paid <S%H5414><s%> for your wares <S%H5801><s%> from Uzal; <S%H187><s%> wrought <S%H6219><s%> iron, <S%H1270><s%> cassia, <S%H6916><s%> and sweet <S%H7070><s%> cane <S%H7070><s%> were among your merchandise. <S%H4627><s%>
"Dedan <S%H1719><s%> traded <S%H7402><s%> with you in saddlecloths <S%H2667><s%> <S%H899><s%> for riding. <S%H7396><s%>

"Arabia <S%H6152><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the princes <S%H5387><s%> of Kedar, <S%H6938><s%> they were your customers <S%H5503><s%> for lambs, <S%H3733><s%> rams, <S%H352><s%> and goats; <S%H6260><s%> for these they were your customers. <S%H5503><s%>

"The traders <S%H7402><s%> of Sheba <S%H7614><s%> and Raamah, <S%H7484><s%> they traded <S%H7402><s%> with you; they paid <S%H5414><s%> for your wares <S%H5801><s%> with the best <S%H7218><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> [kinds] of spices, <S%H1314><s%> and with all <S%H3605><s%> [kinds] of precious <S%H3368><s%> stones, <S%H68><s%> and gold. <S%H2091><s%>
"Haran, <S%H2771><s%> Canneh, <S%H3656><s%> Eden, <S%H5729><s%> the traders <S%H7402><s%> of Sheba, <S%H7614><s%> Asshur, <S%H804><s%> [and] Chilmad <S%H3638><s%> traded <S%H7402><s%> with you.

"They traded <S%H7402><s%> with you in choice <S%H4360><s%> garments, <S%H4360><s%> in clothes <S%H1545><s%> of blue <S%H8504><s%> and embroidered <S%H7553><s%> work, <S%H7553><s%> and in carpets <S%H1595><s%> of many <S%H1264><s%> colors, <S%H1264><s%> [and] tightly <S%H9029><s%> wound <S%H2280><s%> cords, <S%H9112><s%> [which were] among your merchandise. <S%H4819><s%>

"The ships <S%H591><s%> of Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> were the carriers <S%H7788><s%> for your merchandise. <S%H4627><s%> And you were filled <S%H4390><s%> and were very <S%H3966><s%> glorious <S%H3513><s%> In the heart <S%H3820><s%> of the seas. <S%H3220><s%>

"Your rowers <S%H9588><s%> have brought <S%H935><s%> you Into great <S%H7227><s%> waters; <S%H4325><s%> The east <S%H6921><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> has broken <S%H7665><s%> you In the heart <S%H3820><s%> of the seas. <S%H3220><s%>

"Your wealth, <S%H1952><s%> your wares, <S%H5801><s%> your merchandise, <S%H4627><s%> Your sailors, <S%H4419><s%> and your pilots, <S%H2259><s%> Your repairers <S%H2388><s%> of seams, <S%H919><s%> your dealers <S%H6148><s%> in merchandise, <S%H4627><s%> And all <S%H3605><s%> your men <S%H376><s%> of war <S%H4421><s%> who <S%H834><s%> are in you, With all <S%H3605><s%> your company <S%H6951><s%> that is in your midst, <S%H8432><s%> Will fall <S%H5307><s%> into the heart <S%H3820><s%> of the seas <S%H3220><s%> On the day <S%H3117><s%> of your overthrow. <S%H4658><s%>
"At the sound <S%H6963><s%> of the cry <S%H2201><s%> of your pilots <S%H2259><s%> The pasture <S%H4054><s%> lands <S%H4054><s%> will shake. <S%H7493><s%>

"And all <S%H3605><s%> who handle <S%H8610><s%> the oar, <S%H4880><s%> The sailors, <S%H4419><s%> [and] all <S%H3605><s%> the pilots <S%H2259><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%> Will come <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> from their ships; <S%H591><s%> They will stand <S%H5975><s%> on the land, <S%H776><s%>

And they will make <S%H8085><s%> their voice <S%H6963><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> you And will cry <S%H2199><s%> bitterly. <S%H4751><s%> They will cast <S%H5927><s%> dust <S%H6083><s%> on their heads, <S%H7218><s%> They will wallow <S%H6428><s%> in ashes. <S%H665><s%>

"Also they will make <S%H7139><s%> themselves bald <S%H7139><s%> <S%H7144><s%> for you And gird <S%H2296><s%> themselves with sackcloth; <S%H8242><s%> And they will weep <S%H1058><s%> for you in bitterness <S%H4751><s%> of soul <S%H5315><s%> With bitter <S%H4751><s%> mourning. <S%H4553><s%>

"Moreover, in their wailing <S%H5092><s%> they will take <S%H5375><s%> up a lamentation <S%H7015><s%> for you And lament <S%H6969><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> you: 'Who <S%H4310><s%> is like Tyre, <S%H6865><s%> Like her who <S%H1822><s%> is silent <S%H1822><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>?

'When your wares <S%H5801><s%> went <S%H3318><s%> out from the seas, <S%H3220><s%> You satisfied <S%H7646><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> peoples; <S%H5971><s%> With the abundance <S%H7230><s%> of your wealth <S%H1952><s%> and your merchandise <S%H4627><s%> You enriched <S%H6238><s%> the kings <S%H4428><s%> of earth. <S%H776><s%>

'Now <S%H6256><s%> that you are broken <S%H7665><s%> by the seas <S%H3220><s%> In the depths <S%H4615><s%> of the waters, <S%H4325><s%> Your merchandise <S%H4627><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> your company <S%H6951><s%> Have fallen <S%H5307><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of you.

'All <S%H3605><s%> the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the coastlands <S%H339><s%> Are appalled <S%H8074><s%> at you, And their kings <S%H4428><s%> are horribly <S%H9623><s%> afraid; <S%H8175><s%> They are troubled <S%H7481><s%> in countenance. <S%H6440><s%>

'The merchants <S%H5503><s%> among the peoples <S%H5971><s%> hiss <S%H8319><s%> at you; You have become <S%H1961><s%> terrified, <S%H1091><s%> And you will be no <S%H369><s%> more <S%H369><s%>. <S%H5704><s%> <S%H5769><s%>' "'"
